title: Inquiry-Based Social Studies Science Lesson Design Workshop for Pre-Service Elementary Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced social studies education theories, inquiry-based instructional design skills, and understanding of elementary science curricula
context.additional_context: Design and practice of inquiry-based lessons in VR simulation environments replicating real classroom scenarios, focusing on integrating social studies core competencies (problem-solving, decision-making, community awareness) into science instruction.

learning_goals: Utilize step-by-step design principles of social studies inquiry methods to create a three-session lesson plan for science classes.
Develop five or more open-ended/higher-order questions tailored to classroom contexts that foster studentsâ€™ social relationship-building and critical thinking.
Improve 80% or more of inquiry elements in lesson plans through peer feedback and instructor coaching, integrating strategies to strengthen civic competencies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
